text:
205 Front Street, west side, between Fulton and Beekman Streets, showing a building occupied bw Wm. P. Howell, a firm established in
1797.
About 1870 ?
Gift of Edmund B. Childs

Fulton Street, west from Pearl Street. This thoroughfare makes a slight bend at Gold Street. The 12-story structure there, No's. 81-5 Fulton Street, 57 Gold Street and 90 Ann Street, housed the Market and Fulton office of the Irving Trust Co. in 1922. It was demolished in 1930 and a 20-story annex erected to the adjoining Royal Insurance Co. Building. This stage
appears in View 3.
View 1: 1906
George L. Balgue
View 2: January 30, 1928
View 3: January 8, 1931
P. L. Sperr
This structure, erected in 1888, formerly housed the Market and Fulton National Bank, an organization that succeeded the Market Bank (founded in 1852) and the Fulton Bank (organized in 1824). These were consolidated on December 20, 1887 (National charter dated 1864) and this new structure erected on the site of the Fulton Bank. The Market Bank in 1854 established itself at Beekman and Pearl Streets removing here on the unification. On an upper floor is the Fulton Club.

appears in View 3.

Fulton Street, west from Front Street, showing a narrowing of this thoroughfare at Water Street. Beyond same, on Pearl Street appears the Fulton Street station of the South Ferry division of the 2nd and 3rd Ave. Elevated lines. In the background is the Woolworth Building, overshadowing the twin spires of the Park Row Building.

October 1914.
Views 1,2

George L. Balgue.

Fulton Street, west from Front Street, showing a narrowing of this thoroughfare at Water Street. Beyond same, on Pearl Street appears the Fulton Street station of the South Ferry division of the 2nd and 3rd Ave. Elevated lines. In the background is the Woolworth Building, overshadowing the twin spires of the Park Row Building.

October 1914.
Views 1,2

George L. Balgue.

Water Street, at the N.W. corner of Fulton Street. Also shown is Fulton Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Water Street.
About 1921.

Gift of E. M. Jenks.

(1) Fulton Street, south side, east from and including Front, to and including South Streets.
April 1, 1928.

May 29, 1932.

(3) A more inclusive view showing buildings at the S.W. corner. Note the Ferry House on South Street at the rivers edge.
May 1923.

37 Water Street, south side, west of Coenties Slip, (estimated location), general view north.

Looking up Water Street towards Wall Street, showing there the American Sugar Refiners Building. (No. 120 Wall Street) under construction. Beyond same is the Brooklyn Bridge and the East River. The loft structure being erected in the foreground extends thru, the block from Water to Pearl Streets.

September 20, 1929
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Water Street - North.

text:

Looking up Water Street towards Wall Street, showing there the American Sugar Refiners Building. (No. 120 Wall Street) under construction. Beyond same is the Brooklyn Bridge and the East River. The loft structure being erected in the foreground extends thru, the block from Water to Pearl Streets.

title: General view - Water Street - North.

text:
37 Water Street, south side, west of Coenties Slip (estimated location) general view northwestward.

The financial zone as viewed across low structures forming its easterly fringe. Shown are the unfinished Bank of Manhattan, the ornamented Bank of New York Building, the columned Cotton Exchange and the cathedral-like Wall and Hanover Buildings. In the foreground is Pearl Street and its Coenties Slip "El" bend.

September 20, 1929
Views: 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Water Street - Northwest.

title: General view - Water Street - Northwest.

text:
37 Water Street, south side, west of Coenties Slip, (estimated location) general view northeastward).

Up and across the roofs of low buildings that form the financial zone fringe to show the American Sugar Refiners Building (No. 120 Wall Street) silhouetted against the Brooklyn Bridge. To the right is the East River and the Brooklyn shore. Note the memorial cross atop the Seaman's Church Institute, a building on Coenties Slip and South Street.

August 6, 1930
Views: 1 - 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - Water Street - Northeast.

text:
(1) Fulton Street, south side, west from but not including Front, to and including Water Streets. The view shows the stacks of the New York Steam Company and No. 111 John Street in the background.

May 29, 1932
P.L. Sperr

(2) The same, from a different angle and showing from left to right Cities Service Building (at Pine and Pearl Streets), and the Bank of Manhattan Building, (40 Wall Street), in the background over-shadowing the stacks of the New York Steam Company Plant. In the foreground at No. 30 Fulton Street, at the S.E. corner of Water Street, is the oldest drug store in New York, owned and operated by S.A. Brown.

September 23, 1931
P.L. Sperr

(3) The same, as No. 2 from a slightly different angle.

May 29, 1932
P.L. Sperr

33 Fulton Street, north side, between Pearl and Water Streets.

November 19, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Brooklyn Bridge (north from Water Street, foreground). In this view is seen Fulton Street (extreme left) which is the approach to the Bridge. Overhead is the B.M.T. elevated lines and the pedestrians walk.

May 24, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
title: Bridges - Brooklyn Bridge - Brooklyn Approach.

text:
Fulton Street, north side, west from Front (right) to Water (left) Streets and showing at the N.W. corner of the two first mentioned points a ventilator shaft of the Municipal Subway System. To the right appears a northward view on the west side of Front Street, to Beekman Street.

September 13, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

No. 311-13 Water Street, south side, from northwest corner looking south across the clearing.

P. L. Sperr

October 8, 1938
77 Water Street N.Y. 1968
